column1: Your friend texts you. She has an extra ticket to a comedy show tonight...she was going to go with her partner, but they just broke up. The problem: you have a big presentation to deliver tomorrow. You were going to spend the entire night preparing for it. What do you say?
column2: "Sorry, I'm really swamped at work right now!! I hope you're doing okay. Let's catch up soon!"
column6: Your friend responds: "Yay!! It's been way too long!"

column1: A volunteer opportunity pops up in your community. It’s every Saturday afternoon. But it's ski season, and your friend offered to teach you how to ski—and to stay at their cabin whenever you want. What do you do?
column2: Take on the volunteer position. Maybe one day you'll learn how to ski.
column5: You can't say no to these skiing lessons and the cabin.
column6: So much fresh air in store!

column1: You feel a sudden burst of energy after work today. It's time to:
column2: Write the work doc that's been in your backlog for a few weeks.
column3: It feels like a weight's been lifted off your shoulders!
column5: Finally go to the art exhibit you’ve been meaning to check out.
column6: Inspiring. You take some notes for later!

column1: You feel like watching something tonight. What do you choose?
column2: The latest major movie to land on your streaming platform.
column3: You’re excited to wield this new conversation topic heading into the weekend!
column6: You were so good back in the day!

column1: It's about to be Friday night! What's the move?
column2: Take a familiar drive down the highway.
column3: The water is so beautiful at night, isn't it?
column5: Message some people you met last week to get a spontaneous night out going.
column6: Incredible that you pulled this off, and incredible you managed to stay up past midnight!

column1: What shall you do this weekend afternoon?
column2: Brainstorm different paths that could bring you to New York.
column3: You’ve got a journal and a dream!
column6: Finally! You’re excited to hang this one up.

column1: You return to your apartment and your roommate has some friends over to watch the game. You haven't seen this group in a while, and it's always fun talking to them. What's your next move?
column2: Hang out in the living room and ask everyone how they're doing.
column3: You spend a few hours catching up with the whole group. Sounds like some of them have gotten into tennis recently!
column5: Head to your room to catch up on your email before work tomorrow.
column6: You always feel better going into Monday this way!
